page.title: 15Cramlington:Wildlife
page.content: Cramlington has a good variety of wildlife because of its rural setting. {Rabbits,stoats,weasels,hedgehogs,foxes and{voles}are regularly reported,and {deer}are sometimes seen on the town fringes in harder winters. No{badgers are now present within the town boundaries.Local woodlands shelter a good variety of the commoner{woodland {birds,}especially in the N.E. area, where rarer types such as{bullfinches and{goldfinches}have been observed. Wetlands near the town produce occasional visits from{herons}and {migratory geese}and{swans}use the surrounding fields in winter.Local waters support{frogs}and{newts}in good numbers and{toads}are seen in quieter places. There is a healthy{butterfly population ,helped by the many areas of semi-wild vegetation on undeveloped land. Klondyke F.S.
